intro: Tetrapterys acapulcensis, commonly known as the Acapulco tetrapterys, is a species of flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its woody structure and palmate leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. It is often found in humid, tropical environments and thrives in well-drained soil. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
